content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here is an example solution in Julia:
```julia
using Distributed

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    @sync begin
        for str in strings
            @async begin
                println("$stray" * popfirst!(split(str, " ")))
            end
        end
    end
end
```
This function uses the `@sync` macro to ensure that all threads are joined before returning. Each string is split into words and the first word is popped off (using `popfirst!`) before being appended to the end of each pig latin word in a separate thread using `@async`. The result is printed out.

Please note, this function assumes that you want to convert every word in the input string to pig latin and it doesn't handle punctuation or capitalization. Also, it does not return anything as `println` outputs directly to the console. If you need to return a value, you would have to modify this function accordingly.
